job_title: Lecturer in Farnham, South West England, England
pros: Campus is in a nice, small and friendly town with plenty of green space.
cons:
Film Production at UCA used to be a respected course, staffed by experienced lecturers and excellent technical support staff. Student work was strong, often winning awards. 
However, in recent years the middle management of the School of Film, Media and Performing Arts and UCA's senior management have been toxic and chaotic with a high turnover of unqualified people who have systematically destroyed the previously brilliant culture of research, high quality teaching and creativity. There is a culture of blaming lecturing staff for the incompetence of management. 
Simultaneously student numbers have exploded, but resources haven't been provided to support this. 
Result is demoralised and burnt out lecturers and technicians and dissatisfied students and an eroding standard that is now embarrassing to be associated with. Decent staff have been leaving in droves. Avoid!!

job_title: Academic/Recruitment in Farnham, South East England, England
pros: Very committed academics, technical tutors and creative staff
cons:
Bizarre, chaotic and contradictory middle and higher management that seem to deliberately target well performing staff with constant pressure and unclear targets.  

Would agree wholeheartedly with the previous recruitment / Int Dept review.  Extremely toxic environment within International Studies / Recruitment which is not only known to but also enabled by HR, Senior Management and VC level staff.  Inexperienced managers who gaslight and ignore staff and partners, causing havoc for academics, students and stakeholders.   Basic safeguarding knowingly ignored to cut costs. 

Constantly changing objectives with zero logic and blame culture, extremely unprofessional behaviour from management, deliberate sabotaging of their own staff/collaborative partners for no obvious reason, I could go on.... 

The whole International Department is run like Mean Girls which would be amusing if it wasn’t so disheartening for people who actually care about educational quality and just want to get on and do the job and help the university succeed.

Most UK universities have problems with bullying, bad management etc however this is a new level and the worst I have ever come across.  Avoid at all costs unless you enjoy contracts being changed overnight, financial incentives offered and later rescinded and bizarre mgmt decisions that can often change by the hour.   If you challenge any of this be prepared for personal reprisals and attempts to discredit you across the University even after you leave, extremely strange and pointless. 

Talented staff should head for the better known universities particularly if working for them internationally - UCA have/cultivate zero understanding of international contracts, living costs or expectations which can cause troubling financial, legal and stress issues for you later on.
